prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout Construct a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.03). Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Start by drawing line 1 from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0). Next, draw line 2 from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.45). Then, draw line 3 from (0.75, 0.45) to (0, 0.45). Finally, draw line 4 from (0, 0.45) to (0, 0) to close the loop. Part 2: Construction of a set of cylindrical objects with varying shapes and arrangements Construct a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.0237, 0.0146, 0.03). Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw a circle at (0.09, 0.0935) with a radius of 0.09. Create a new sketch on face 2 of the coordinate system. Draw a circle at (0.1106, 0.3173) with a radius of 0.09. Create a new sketch on face 3 of the coordinate system. Draw a circle at (0.3148, 0.2687) with a radius of 0.09. Create a new sketch on face 4 of the coordinate system. Draw a circle at (0.5328, 0.09) with a radius of 0.09. For each sketch, extrude the shape from the X-Y plane by a depth of 0.024 units, resulting in a set of cylindrical objects with varying shapes and arrangements, including flat, round, and triangular formations, as well as objects with holes and offsets. The final CAD assembly will consist of these two parts, with the cylindrical objects intersecting and interfering with the rectangular prism to form a series of cylindrical holes aligned vertically along its length. The overall shape will have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.06 units</description>
